title: [K-12] Museum Space Design Project Based on Early Childhood Cognitive Development

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge (spatial analysis, measurement, data visualization) and experience in elementary education environment design
context.additional_context: Participants combine mathematical modeling with spatial design principles to plan museum exhibits optimized for early childhood development stages, including digital tool-based prototyping and evaluation.

learning_goals: Develop two or more spatial layout designs applying early childhood cognitive development theories (sensorimotor stage, preoperational stage).
Design three or more exhibition zones with verified educational effectiveness through mathematical spatial analysis (area calculation, traffic flow optimization).

Utilizing 3D modeling software (e.g., Tinkercad, Fusion 360), learners can design full-scale virtual spaces (e.g., rooms, classrooms) and perform simulations reflecting physical constraints (wall thickness, door size, etc.) for structural stability and spatial efficiency analysis at least three times.

resources: Early Childhood Development Stage-Based Space Design Guidelines
Digital Measurement Tools for Space (e.g., Laser Measurer)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
